intro: Maytenus coriacea, commonly known as the rough mayten, is a shrub or small tree native to South America. It belongs to the family Elaeocarpaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-white flowers followed by woody, spherical fruits. Its leaves are typically alternate and have a rough texture, contributing to its common name. Maytenus coriacea is often found in dry forest ecosystems and is valued for its hardy nature and potential medicinal properties.
